resources.string: Hey Checkout \‘Lynket\’ for quick and secure browsing experience! Download here https://goo.gl/992ils
Compatible custom tab provider not found

Lynket requires you to have any Custom tab compatible browser on your phone. Currently there are no browsers on your phone that supports it. Would you like to install Google Chrome (Free) from play store? If you already have it, then please update it to latest version.

Could not find compatible custom tab browser on your phone. Google Chrome (Free) is recommended. You can still view webpages within Lynket and use Article mode, but for the best experience, a custom tab provider is highly recommended. Would you like to install now?
Could not open custom tab, falling back to webview.
Not a supported link, try again
Hello! \nLynket is a light-weight, secure and a fast web browser.
It can stack multiple links in floating bubbles when you open them and then load them in background!
Just set Lynket as your default browser, Lynket will display the link in a non-intrusive way. Or choose Lynket when needed.
Set Lynket as default to open all links, or you can choose Lynket from the list when it is shown
is set as the default browser, please clear it by clicking clear defaults.
Keep your browser in memory for faster launch
Scan your screen for links and load them in background for instant launch

This service will be used by Lynket to scan text links on your screen and load them in the background. No other information is processed by Lynket. You can still use Lynket in light mode if you choose to not grant this. For more information, launch Lynket app.

To allow Lynket to scan for links in any app, it requires you to grant accessibility service permission. Please grant accessibility permission in the next screen, after which you can enable this option and enjoy quick launches.
Show notification when a link is prefetched
To enable dynamic coloring of toolbar, Lynket learns the colors silently. It might not come initially for a website or an app, but it will improve over time with usage. Enjoy!
%1$s set as your favorite share app!
%1$s will be used to provide Custom Tabs!
Color will be based on website if the site supports it else will be based on app
Color will be based on app that launches the website
Color will be based on the launched website
To enable dynamic coloring of toolbar based on apps, Lynket needs your permission to know the apps you are using. Would you like to grant this permission now?
To enable per app settings, Lynket needs your permission to know the apps you are using. Would you like to grant usage access permission now?
Choose where the web heads initially appears
To draw the web heads on screen, screen overlay permission needs to be granted. Would you like to grant it now?
When you open a link in any app, a floating bubble called web head will be created on screen and Lynket will attempt to prefetch the link.
On opening multiple links, these web heads will automatically stack on each other. Long press on web head to access the context menu.
When you start dragging a web head, a trash will be shown. Drop on this trash to delete the web head.
Aggressive background loading will load the page in background while you continue to use the app you are in. \n A flicker of opening the tab might appear. This is intentional and not a bug.
Lynket prioritizes the last opened link and pre-fetches it. The recommended method is to click the web heads one by one from top to bottom. Enabling close web heads on launch wil make this seamless.
To open links in floating bubbles, Lynket needs drawing over other apps permission, please grant to continue or disable Web Heads in Lynket settings.

Beta releases are experimental builds that has the latest features but has few bugs. You can contribute to the development by joining as tester and then reporting bugs you face in the Google+ Community. 

Please make sure you have joined the Google+ community, and then click the become a tester button to go to Google Play testing link. 

NOTE: You have to join the community to become a tester.
No compatible voice recognition apps found
Could not share to the app, defaulting to normal share
You can now revoke Lynket\'s accessibility service permission.
See your tabs with other recent apps on your phone\'s Overview screen.
Shows an additional toolbar with extra options
Choose the size of web heads
Changelog skipped due to an error
Help translate app to your language.
Web pages will be loaded in background instead of just pre-fetching
Aggressive background loading requires merge tabs and apps preference to be enabled. It is enabled for you now.
Disabling merge tabs and apps will also disable aggressive background loading.
Your apps and web site tabs live together in your recents screen.
Web heads will disappear once you open the link
Article view - Open the page in Article reader mode.
It looks like the secondary browser that you have chosen is not installed in the system anymore. Would you like to visit the settings page to edit your secondary browser preference?
Could not launch the link with the browser you have chosen. Would you like to edit this setting?
You have blacklisted this app from handing links to Lynket but have not set a secondary browser. Would you like to set your secondary browser now?
List - Limited app support. Eg: Join, Pushbullet etc.
Websites slide over the app you are using.
Websites load in the background allowing you to stack multiple links and then get back to them later with floating bubbles on screen.
Load pages faster with below options
Load mobile optimized version of the website for much quicker and smoother reading experience.
Load sleek looking reader mode with no extra stuff focusing just on the content.
In Slide-over mode, it might take a short while to grab the website\'s AMP url. You might see a dialog when this happens.
This action will delete all history and it is not reversible.
Recently opened links will appear here
When both AMP and Article mode is on, Lynket will try to load AMP version of the page if it exists. If not article mode will be loaded.
Web pages slide over the app you are using and you can press X to quickly return to the app
Your device does not seem to have standard Grant draw overlay permission screen. Please contact your manufacturer to resolve this.
Disabling history will stop recording items here.
Disabling history will stop recording items here. The custom tab provider, %1$s might still record entries.
Love to code? Fork Lynket and contribute.
Web View disabled on device. Could not open link.
Notification will be posted when Lynket\'s app detection service is running.
Monitoring foreground apps for dynamic toolbar color and per app settings.
Certain recent versions of Chrome might force close when Bottom Bar is enabled. If such an issue exists, please disable Bottom Bar until Chrome is patched.
This action will delete all active tabs and it is not reversible.
For full incognito browsing Lynket will switch to Webview for rendering pages. Entries will not be recorded anywhere.
Configure secondary browser and incognito mode for apps individually.
Required for incognito mode. Turn off incognito for choosing another provider.
Would like to save this size?
For your Android version, using WebView is not recommended due to stability and security concerns.
Rendering engine bundled with your phone.
WebView lacks many advantages like data saver, form auto fill and cloud sync that Custom Tab providers provide. Do you still want to use WebView for rendering web pages?
Press X to quickly close the tab
Lynket can work alongside your favorite browsers. \n \n For example, using Google Chrome as provider will let you sync history, use data saver and saved passwords in your Google account.
Lynket can find and load AMP pages automatically which leads to quicker and smoother reading experience.
See tips to get the best out of Lynket
Lynket supports any browser implementing the Custom Tab protocol. Lynket also inherits behaviour from the provider chosen. For example, using Brave will enable adblock.
You can choose a secondary browser and a sharing app to quickly launch/share to them.
You can use bottom bar actions Minimize and Tabs to multitask efficiently.
Tapping keywords in article mode will automatically do a query search.
You can use Lynket\'s quick settings toggle in status bar to quickly change your browsing preferences.
Minimize and open Web Head always
Use Android 10\'s native bubbles to load multiple links in floating windows.

Native bubbles integration is in beta and requires extra steps to be enabled. Please note that current implementation is not final and may change in the future. 

Known issues:
Only WebView provider works with floating window.
Showing bubble notifications, swipe to expand
